noun.description: Punishment inflicted on someone as vengeance for a wrong or criminal act.
examples: employees asked not to be named, saying they feared retribution
Minos threatened war against Athens in retribution for his son's death

origin: Late Middle English (also in the sense recompense for merit or a service): from late Latin retributio(n-), from retribut- assigned again, from the verb retribuere, from re- back + tribuere assign.
